trans-unit.source: Use AES-128 Dynamic Encryption and Key Delivery Service
trans-unit.target: Use AES-128 Dynamic Encryption and Key Delivery Service

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Media Services enables you to deliver your content encrypted with AES 128-bit encryption keys.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Media Services enables you to deliver your content encrypted with AES 128-bit encryption keys.

trans-unit.source: Media Services also provides the Key Delivery service that delivers encryption keys to authorized users.
trans-unit.target: Media Services also provides the Key Delivery service that delivers encryption keys to authorized users.

trans-unit.source: This topic shows how to dynamically encrypt with AES-128 and use the key delivery service.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows how to dynamically encrypt with AES-128 and use the key delivery service.

trans-unit.source: Use AES-128 Dynamic Encryption and Key Delivery Service
trans-unit.target: Use AES-128 Dynamic Encryption and Key Delivery Service

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.SELECTOR]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.SELECTOR]

trans-unit.source: .NET
trans-unit.target: .NET

trans-unit.source: Java
trans-unit.target: Java

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Media Services enables you to deliver Http-Live-Streaming (HLS) and Smooth Streams encrypted with Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) (using 128-bit encryption keys).
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Media Services enables you to deliver Http-Live-Streaming (HLS) and Smooth Streams encrypted with Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) (using 128-bit encryption keys).

trans-unit.source: Media Services also provides the Key Delivery service that delivers encryption keys to authorized users.
trans-unit.target: Media Services also provides the Key Delivery service that delivers encryption keys to authorized users.

trans-unit.source: If you want for Media Services to encrypt an asset, you need to associate an encryption key with the asset and also configure authorization policies for the key.
trans-unit.target: If you want for Media Services to encrypt an asset, you need to associate an encryption key with the asset and also configure authorization policies for the key.

trans-unit.source: When a stream is requested by a player, Media Services uses the specified key to dynamically encrypt your content using AES encryption.
trans-unit.target: When a stream is requested by a player, Media Services uses the specified key to dynamically encrypt your content using AES encryption.

trans-unit.source: To decrypt the stream, the player will request the key from the key delivery service.
trans-unit.target: To decrypt the stream, the player will request the key from the key delivery service.

trans-unit.source: To decide whether or not the user is authorized to get the key, the service evaluates the authorization policies that you specified for the key.
trans-unit.target: To decide whether or not the user is authorized to get the key, the service evaluates the authorization policies that you specified for the key.

trans-unit.source: Media Services supports multiple ways of authenticating users who make key requests.
trans-unit.target: Media Services supports multiple ways of authenticating users who make key requests.

trans-unit.source: The content key authorization policy could have one or more authorization restrictions: open, token restriction, or IP restriction.
trans-unit.target: The content key authorization policy could have one or more authorization restrictions: open, token restriction, or IP restriction.

trans-unit.source: The token restricted policy must be accompanied by a token issued by a Secure Token Service (STS).
trans-unit.target: The token restricted policy must be accompanied by a token issued by a Secure Token Service (STS).

trans-unit.source: Media Services supports tokens in the [Simple Web Tokens](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/gg185950.aspx#BKMK_2) (SWT) format and [JSON Web Token](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/gg185950.aspx#BKMK_3) (JWT) format.
trans-unit.target: Media Services supports tokens in the [Simple Web Tokens](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/gg185950.aspx#BKMK_2) (SWT) format and [JSON Web Token](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/gg185950.aspx#BKMK_3) (JWT) format.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Configure the content key’s authorization policy](media-services-protect-with-aes128.md#configure_key_auth_policy).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Configure the content key’s authorization policy](media-services-protect-with-aes128.md#configure_key_auth_policy).

trans-unit.source: To take advantage of dynamic encryption, you need to have an asset that contains a set of multi-bitrate MP4 files or multi-bitrate Smooth Streaming source files.
trans-unit.target: To take advantage of dynamic encryption, you need to have an asset that contains a set of multi-bitrate MP4 files or multi-bitrate Smooth Streaming source files.

trans-unit.source: You also need to configure the delivery policy for the asset (described later in this topic).
trans-unit.target: You also need to configure the delivery policy for the asset (described later in this topic).

trans-unit.source: Then, based on the format specified in the streaming URL, the On-Demand Streaming server will ensure that the stream is delivered in the protocol you have chosen.
trans-unit.target: Then, based on the format specified in the streaming URL, the On-Demand Streaming server will ensure that the stream is delivered in the protocol you have chosen.

trans-unit.source: As a result, you only need to store and pay for the files in single storage format and Media Services service will build and serve the appropriate response based on requests from a client.
trans-unit.target: As a result, you only need to store and pay for the files in single storage format and Media Services service will build and serve the appropriate response based on requests from a client.

trans-unit.source: This topic would be useful to developers that work on applications that deliver protected media.
trans-unit.target: This topic would be useful to developers that work on applications that deliver protected media.

trans-unit.source: The topic shows you how to configure the key delivery service with authorization policies so that only authorized clients could receive the encryption keys.
trans-unit.target: The topic shows you how to configure the key delivery service with authorization policies so that only authorized clients could receive the encryption keys.

trans-unit.source: It also shows how to use dynamic encryption.
trans-unit.target: It also shows how to use dynamic encryption.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]To start using dynamic encryption, you must first get at least one scale unit (also known as streaming unit).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]To start using dynamic encryption, you must first get at least one scale unit (also known as streaming unit).

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [How to Scale a Media Service](media-services-manage-origins.md#scale_streaming_endpoints).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [How to Scale a Media Service](media-services-manage-origins.md#scale_streaming_endpoints).

trans-unit.source: AES-128 Dynamic Encryption and Key Delivery Service Workflow
trans-unit.target: AES-128 Dynamic Encryption and Key Delivery Service Workflow

trans-unit.source: The following are general steps that you would need to perform when encrypting your assets with AES, using the Media Services key delivery service, and also using dynamic encryption.
trans-unit.target: The following are general steps that you would need to perform when encrypting your assets with AES, using the Media Services key delivery service, and also using dynamic encryption.

trans-unit.source: [Create an asset and upload files into the asset](media-services-protect-with-aes128.md#create_asset).
trans-unit.target: [Create an asset and upload files into the asset](media-services-protect-with-aes128.md#create_asset).

trans-unit.source: [Encode the asset containing the file to the adaptive bitrate MP4 set](media-services-protect-with-aes128.md#encode_asset).
trans-unit.target: [Encode the asset containing the file to the adaptive bitrate MP4 set](media-services-protect-with-aes128.md#encode_asset).

trans-unit.source: [Create a content key and associate it with the encoded asset](media-services-protect-with-aes128.md#create_contentkey).
trans-unit.target: [Create a content key and associate it with the encoded asset](media-services-protect-with-aes128.md#create_contentkey).

trans-unit.source: In Media Services, the content key contains the asset’s encryption key.
trans-unit.target: In Media Services, the content key contains the asset’s encryption key.

trans-unit.source: [Configure the content key’s authorization policy](media-services-protect-with-aes128.md#configure_key_auth_policy).
trans-unit.target: [Configure the content key’s authorization policy](media-services-protect-with-aes128.md#configure_key_auth_policy).

trans-unit.source: The content key authorization policy must be configured by you and met by the client in order for the content key to be delivered to the client.
trans-unit.target: The content key authorization policy must be configured by you and met by the client in order for the content key to be delivered to the client.

trans-unit.source: [Configure the delivery policy for an asset](media-services-protect-with-aes128.md#configure_asset_delivery_policy).
trans-unit.target: [Configure the delivery policy for an asset](media-services-protect-with-aes128.md#configure_asset_delivery_policy).

trans-unit.source: The delivery policy configuration includes: key acquisition URL and Initialization Vector (IV) (AES 128 requires the same IV to be supplied when encrypting and decrypting), delivery protocol (for example, MPEG DASH, HLS, HDS, Smooth Streaming or all), the type of dynamic encryption (for example, envelope or no dynamic encryption).
trans-unit.target: The delivery policy configuration includes: key acquisition URL and Initialization Vector (IV) (AES 128 requires the same IV to be supplied when encrypting and decrypting), delivery protocol (for example, MPEG DASH, HLS, HDS, Smooth Streaming or all), the type of dynamic encryption (for example, envelope or no dynamic encryption).

trans-unit.source: You could apply different policy to each protocol on the same asset.
trans-unit.target: You could apply different policy to each protocol on the same asset.

trans-unit.source: For example, you could apply PlayReady encryption to Smooth/DASH and AES Envelope to HLS.
trans-unit.target: For example, you could apply PlayReady encryption to Smooth/DASH and AES Envelope to HLS.

trans-unit.source: Any protocols that are not defined in a delivery policy (for example, you add a single policy that only specifies HLS as the protocol) will be blocked from streaming.
trans-unit.target: Any protocols that are not defined in a delivery policy (for example, you add a single policy that only specifies HLS as the protocol) will be blocked from streaming.

trans-unit.source: The exception to this is if you have no asset delivery policy defined at all.
trans-unit.target: The exception to this is if you have no asset delivery policy defined at all.

trans-unit.source: Then, all protocols will be allowed in the clear.
trans-unit.target: Then, all protocols will be allowed in the clear.

trans-unit.source: [Create an OnDemand locator](media-services-protect-with-aes128.md#create_locator) in order to get a streaming URL.
trans-unit.target: [Create an OnDemand locator](media-services-protect-with-aes128.md#create_locator) in order to get a streaming URL.

trans-unit.source: The topic also shows [how a client application can request a key from the key delivery service](media-services-protect-with-aes128.md#client_request).
trans-unit.target: The topic also shows [how a client application can request a key from the key delivery service](media-services-protect-with-aes128.md#client_request).

trans-unit.source: You will find a complete .NET [example](media-services-protect-with-aes128.md#example) at the end of the topic.
trans-unit.target: You will find a complete .NET [example](media-services-protect-with-aes128.md#example) at the end of the topic.

trans-unit.source: The following image demonstrates the workflow described above.
trans-unit.target: The following image demonstrates the workflow described above.

trans-unit.source: Here the token is used for authentication.
trans-unit.target: Here the token is used for authentication.

trans-unit.source: Protect with AES-128
trans-unit.target: Protect with AES-128

trans-unit.source: The rest of this topic provides detailed explanations, code examples, and links to topics that show you how to achieve the tasks described above.
trans-unit.target: The rest of this topic provides detailed explanations, code examples, and links to topics that show you how to achieve the tasks described above.

trans-unit.source: Current limitations
trans-unit.target: Current limitations

trans-unit.source: If you add or update your asset’s delivery policy, you must delete an existing locator (if any) and create a new locator.
trans-unit.target: If you add or update your asset’s delivery policy, you must delete an existing locator (if any) and create a new locator.

trans-unit.source: Create an asset and upload files into the asset
trans-unit.target: Create an asset and upload files into the asset

trans-unit.source: In order to manage, encode, and stream your videos, you must first upload your content into Microsoft Azure Media Services.
trans-unit.target: In order to manage, encode, and stream your videos, you must first upload your content into Microsoft Azure Media Services.

trans-unit.source: Once uploaded, your content is stored securely in the cloud for further processing and streaming.
trans-unit.target: Once uploaded, your content is stored securely in the cloud for further processing and streaming.

trans-unit.source: The following code snippet shows how to create an asset and upload the specified file into the asset.
trans-unit.target: The following code snippet shows how to create an asset and upload the specified file into the asset.

trans-unit.source: Encode the asset containing the file to the adaptive bitrate MP4 set
trans-unit.target: Encode the asset containing the file to the adaptive bitrate MP4 set

trans-unit.source: With dynamic encryption all you need is to create an asset that contains a set of multi-bitrate MP4 files or multi-bitrate Smooth Streaming source files.
trans-unit.target: With dynamic encryption all you need is to create an asset that contains a set of multi-bitrate MP4 files or multi-bitrate Smooth Streaming source files.

trans-unit.source: Then, based on the specified format in the manifest or fragment request, the On-Demand Streaming server will ensure that you receive the stream in the protocol you have chosen.
trans-unit.target: Then, based on the specified format in the manifest or fragment request, the On-Demand Streaming server will ensure that you receive the stream in the protocol you have chosen.

trans-unit.source: As a result, you only need to store and pay for the files in single storage format and Media Services service will build and serve the appropriate response based on requests from a client.
trans-unit.target: As a result, you only need to store and pay for the files in single storage format and Media Services service will build and serve the appropriate response based on requests from a client.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the [Dynamic Packaging Overview](media-services-dynamic-packaging-overview.md) topic.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the [Dynamic Packaging Overview](media-services-dynamic-packaging-overview.md) topic.

trans-unit.source: The following code snippet shows you how to encode an asset to adaptive bitrate MP4 set:
trans-unit.target: The following code snippet shows you how to encode an asset to adaptive bitrate MP4 set:

trans-unit.source: Create a content key and associate it with the encoded asset
trans-unit.target: Create a content key and associate it with the encoded asset

trans-unit.source: In Media Services, the content key contains the key that you want to encrypt an asset with.
trans-unit.target: In Media Services, the content key contains the key that you want to encrypt an asset with.

trans-unit.source: For detailed information, see [Create content key](media-services-dotnet-create-contentkey.md).
trans-unit.target: For detailed information, see [Create content key](media-services-dotnet-create-contentkey.md).

trans-unit.source: Configure the content key’s authorization policy
trans-unit.target: Configure the content key’s authorization policy

trans-unit.source: Media Services supports multiple ways of authenticating users who make key requests.
trans-unit.target: Media Services supports multiple ways of authenticating users who make key requests.

trans-unit.source: The content key authorization policy must be configured by you and met by the client (player) in order for the key to be delivered to the client.
trans-unit.target: The content key authorization policy must be configured by you and met by the client (player) in order for the key to be delivered to the client.

trans-unit.source: The content key authorization policy could have one or more authorization restrictions: open, token restriction, or IP restriction.
trans-unit.target: The content key authorization policy could have one or more authorization restrictions: open, token restriction, or IP restriction.

trans-unit.source: For detailed information, see [Configure Content Key Authorization Policy](media-services-dotnet-configure-content-key-auth-policy.md).
trans-unit.target: For detailed information, see [Configure Content Key Authorization Policy](media-services-dotnet-configure-content-key-auth-policy.md).

trans-unit.source: Configure asset delivery policy
trans-unit.target: Configure asset delivery policy

trans-unit.source: Configure the delivery policy for your asset.
trans-unit.target: Configure the delivery policy for your asset.

trans-unit.source: Some things that the asset delivery policy configuration includes:
trans-unit.target: Some things that the asset delivery policy configuration includes:

trans-unit.source: The Key acquisition URL.
trans-unit.target: The Key acquisition URL.

trans-unit.source: The Initialization Vector (IV) to use for the envelope encryption.
trans-unit.target: The Initialization Vector (IV) to use for the envelope encryption.

trans-unit.source: AES 128 requires the same IV to be supplied when encrypting and decrypting.
trans-unit.target: AES 128 requires the same IV to be supplied when encrypting and decrypting.

trans-unit.source: The asset delivery protocol (for example, MPEG DASH, HLS, HDS, Smooth Streaming or all).
trans-unit.target: The asset delivery protocol (for example, MPEG DASH, HLS, HDS, Smooth Streaming or all).

trans-unit.source: The type of dynamic encryption (for example, AES envelope) or no dynamic encryption.
trans-unit.target: The type of dynamic encryption (for example, AES envelope) or no dynamic encryption.

trans-unit.source: For detailed information, see [Configure asset delivery policy ](media-services-rest-configure-asset-delivery-policy.md).
trans-unit.target: For detailed information, see [Configure asset delivery policy ](media-services-rest-configure-asset-delivery-policy.md).

trans-unit.source: Create an OnDemand streaming locator in order to get a streaming URL
trans-unit.target: Create an OnDemand streaming locator in order to get a streaming URL

trans-unit.source: You will need to provide your user with the streaming URL for Smooth, DASH or HLS.
trans-unit.target: You will need to provide your user with the streaming URL for Smooth, DASH or HLS.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]If you add or update your asset’s delivery policy, you must delete an existing locator (if any) and create a new locator.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]If you add or update your asset’s delivery policy, you must delete an existing locator (if any) and create a new locator.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on how to publish an asset and build a streaming URL, see [Build a streaming URL](media-services-deliver-streaming-content.md).
trans-unit.target: For instructions on how to publish an asset and build a streaming URL, see [Build a streaming URL](media-services-deliver-streaming-content.md).

trans-unit.source: Get a test token
trans-unit.target: Get a test token

trans-unit.source: Get a test token based on the token restriction that was used for the key authorization policy.
trans-unit.target: Get a test token based on the token restriction that was used for the key authorization policy.

trans-unit.source: You can use the [AMS Player](http://amsplayer.azurewebsites.net/azuremediaplayer.html) to test your stream.
trans-unit.target: You can use the [AMS Player](http://amsplayer.azurewebsites.net/azuremediaplayer.html) to test your stream.

trans-unit.source: How can your client request a key from the key delivery service?
trans-unit.target: How can your client request a key from the key delivery service?

trans-unit.source: In the previous step, you constructed the URL that points to a manifest file.
trans-unit.target: In the previous step, you constructed the URL that points to a manifest file.

trans-unit.source: Your client needs to extract the necessary information from the streaming manifest files in order to make a request to the key delivery service.
trans-unit.target: Your client needs to extract the necessary information from the streaming manifest files in order to make a request to the key delivery service.

trans-unit.source: Manifest files
trans-unit.target: Manifest files

trans-unit.source: The client needs to extract the URL (that also contains content key Id (kid)) value from the manifest file.
trans-unit.target: The client needs to extract the URL (that also contains content key Id (kid)) value from the manifest file.

trans-unit.source: The client will then try to get the encryption key from the key delivery service.
trans-unit.target: The client will then try to get the encryption key from the key delivery service.

trans-unit.source: The client also needs to extract the IV value and use it do decrypt the stream.The following snippet shows the
trans-unit.target: The client also needs to extract the IV value and use it do decrypt the stream.The following snippet shows the

trans-unit.source: element of the Smooth Streaming manifest.
trans-unit.target: element of the Smooth Streaming manifest.

trans-unit.source: In the case of HLS, the root manifest is broken into segment files.
trans-unit.target: In the case of HLS, the root manifest is broken into segment files.

trans-unit.source: For example, the root manifest is: http://test001.origin.mediaservices.windows.net/8bfe7d6f-34e3-4d1a-b289-3e48a8762490/BigBuckBunny.ism/manifest(format=m3u8-aapl) and it contains a list of segment file names.
trans-unit.target: For example, the root manifest is: http://test001.origin.mediaservices.windows.net/8bfe7d6f-34e3-4d1a-b289-3e48a8762490/BigBuckBunny.ism/manifest(format=m3u8-aapl) and it contains a list of segment file names.

trans-unit.source: If you open one of the segment files in text editor (for example, http://test001.origin.mediaservices.windows.net/8bfe7d6f-34e3-4d1a-b289-3e48a8762490/BigBuckBunny.ism/QualityLevels(514369)/Manifest(video,format=m3u8-aapl), it should contain #EXT-X-KEY which indicates that the file is encrypted.
trans-unit.target: If you open one of the segment files in text editor (for example, http://test001.origin.mediaservices.windows.net/8bfe7d6f-34e3-4d1a-b289-3e48a8762490/BigBuckBunny.ism/QualityLevels(514369)/Manifest(video,format=m3u8-aapl), it should contain #EXT-X-KEY which indicates that the file is encrypted.

trans-unit.source: Request the key from the key delivery service
trans-unit.target: Request the key from the key delivery service

trans-unit.source: The following code shows how to send a request to the Media Services key delivery service using a key delivery Uri (that was extracted from the manifest) and a token (this topic does not talk about how to get Simple Web Tokens from a Secure Token Service).
trans-unit.target: The following code shows how to send a request to the Media Services key delivery service using a key delivery Uri (that was extracted from the manifest) and a token (this topic does not talk about how to get Simple Web Tokens from a Secure Token Service).

trans-unit.source: Example
trans-unit.target: Example

trans-unit.source: Create a new Console project.
trans-unit.target: Create a new Console project.

trans-unit.target: Use NuGet to install and add Azure Media Services .NET SDK Extensions.

trans-unit.source: Installing this package, also installs Media Services .NET SDK and adds all other required dependencies.
trans-unit.target: Installing this package, also installs Media Services .NET SDK and adds all other required dependencies.

trans-unit.target: Add config file that contains the account name and key information:

trans-unit.target: Overwrite the code in your Program.cs file with the code shown in this section.

trans-unit.target: Make sure to update variables to point to folders where your input files are located.
